3.2.title: Earth Childhood
desc: Born with a silver nanoswarm in your blood
Precariat: poverty just a step away
Troubled: raised among disaster or war

3.3.title: Orbital Childhood
desc: A new star born above the Earth
Orbital colonist; floating above the masses
One of the lucky few to live above

3.4.title: Lunar Childhood
desc: Raised with a view of Earth

3.9.title: Created Not Born
desc: Second-class citizenship was not for you

table.desc: Gain +1 Moxie and roll on the Story Event table
Traumatic childhood accident. Gain the Mental Disorder (PTSD) trait.
You are not only good with your hands, you are good with both hands. Gain the Ambidexterity trait
The people that raise you do not tolerate foolishness. Gain the Common Sense trait
You are raised in an abusive environment. Gain the Pain Tolerance (Level 1) trait
You fall in with the wrong crowd. Ignore your last roll on the Youth Path table and take the Street Rat package for the same amount of PP as you rolled. Proceed to Step 5.
You are kept at home and not allowed to play sports or with other kids. Lose –5 COO.
You grow up in a maze-like urban area or a difficult rural area. Gain the Direction Sense trait
You are raised in dangerous conditions where you have to adapt or die. Gain the Fast Learner trait
You skip too much school. –20 to one skill.
Growing up isolated from others, you develop introvert tendencies. Lose –5 SAV.
While your friends throw themselves into VR gaming worlds, you simply throw up. Gain the VR Vertigo trait
Raised in an environment of constant stimulus, you are forced to tune out. Gain the Oblivious trait
You grow up in a melting-pot, polyglot culture. Gain the Hyper Linguist trait
You party too hard. –20 to one skill.
Your childhood education is poor to non-existent. Gain the Illiterate trait
A healthy amount of physical activities improves your abilities. Gain +5 COO
One (or both) of your parents is bilingual. Gain +20 to a Language skill of your choice.
A misunderstood situation makes you the laughing stock of your peer group. Gain the Socially Graceless trait
Shoplifting and stealing are either hobbies or a necessity. Gain +10 Palming skill.
You experiment with drugs, but it isn’t for you. Gain the Drug Exception trait
A dysfunctional home life keeps you from doing well in school. Lose –5 COG.
Being a bully has its advantages. Gain +10 Intimidation skill.
Your first experiments with forking prove to you that merging will not be easy. Gain the Divergent Personality trait
You receive your first cortical stack at an early age—and luckily just in time. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You are raised around animals. Gain +10 Animal Handling skill.
Your parents raise you with some unusual ideas. Gain the Faulty Education trait
You cheat your way through school. –10 to one skill.
You enjoy urban exploration and getting into off-limits areas. Gain +10 to either Climbing or Infiltration skill.
You hone your headshot skills in VR combat simulations. Gain the Murder Simulator Addict trait
Because you excel in your studies, you are placed in an advanced program. Gain +5 COG.
Your parents are highly private and extremely strict. Gain the Poorly Socialized trait
You leave home at an early age and forge your own path. Gain +1 Moxie.
One of your personality quirks gains you some attention from peers, but then it becomes a permanent and noticeable part of your daily behavior. Gain the Identifiable Quirk trait
As a free-range kid, you learn how to get around on your own. Gain +10 Navigation skill.
One of your parental figures abandons you as a child. Gain the Trusting Heart trait
A series of childhood injuries leaves you struggling to catch up physically. Lose –5 SOM.
You lose all of your close friends in a horribly awkward teen social situation. Gain the Not a Team Player trait
Tormented by bullies as a kid, you learn to stand up for yourself. Gain +10 Unarmed Combat skill.
The strictness of your parents leaves you only one choice: to excel at lying. Gain +10 Deception skill.
Adult generations are never quite as on-top of technological changes, and you use that to your advantage. Gain +10 Infosec skill
Gain +1 Moxie and roll on the Story Event table
You save an animal from danger. Gain the Animal Empathy trait ).
You take up a sport. +10 to Climbing, Fray, Free Fall, Freerunning, or Swimming.
Your inability to improve holds you back from an important promotion/advancement. Gain the Slow Learner trait ).
You simply are not very comfortable with that whole resleeving thing. Gain the Morphing Disorder (Level 1) trait ).
You are not a slacker. You take on part-time jobs or additional training. +20 to one skill.
You travel extensively. +10 to two different Language skills.
Regular attention to your health and exercise improves your abilities. Gain +5 SOM.
You decide you want to experiment. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table but ignore pods.
You are fired and your new career hopes are now dashed. Re-roll your Adult Pre-Fall Path.
You pick up a new hobby. +20 to one Art or Interest skill.
An unfortunate habitat failure, traffic accident, or fire ends your life. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table but ignore pods and uplifts.
You travel extensively: +20 to Navigation skill.
Your work requires you to change your morph. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table but ignore pods and uplifts.
Curiosity gets the better of you. Lose –5 to one aptitude.
You lose a limb in a traumatic incident, but grow it back. Gain +1 Moxie.
An experience with still-unrefined psychosurgery leaves you forever altered. Gain the Anomalous Mind trait
Something goes seriously glitchy with your muse, and you are nearly hurt as a result. Gain the Phobia Disorder (Muse) trait
You are a pioneer in the practice of egocasting. Gain the Ego Plasticity (Level 1) trait roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You save someone from drowning. Gain +10 Swimming skill.
You experiment with some minor self-modification. Gain the Modified Behavior (Level 1) trait
You exhibit a serious lack of willpower in coping with your adult life. Gain the Addiction (Major) trait
You experience a deadly vehicle accident. Lose 10,000 from your starting credit and roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
A hacker friend shows you a few things, and then you show them a few things. Gain the Intuitive Cracker (Level 1) trait
The poor state of affairs on Earth before the Fall impacts you heavily. Gain the Mental Disorder (Depression) trait
You spend some time in some of the rougher, crisis-impacted areas on Earth before the Fall. Gain +10 Fray skill.
A period of poverty leaves you with the skills to get by. Gain +10 Scrounging skill.
You are implicated in a news-making scandal. Lose –10 c-rep.
You pick up a new hobby. Gain +10 to one Art or Interest skill.
You are an early adopter of psychosurgery, finding that your mind adapts well to changes. Gain the Malleable Mind (Level 1) trait
The stress of rapid technological change overwhelms you. Gain the Mental Disorder (ADHD) trait ).
You study or train hard. Gain a free specialization in one skill.
You take up martial arts training. Gain +10 Unarmed Combat skill.
You choose your own path over what others tell you to do. Replace any one skill you have gained so far with any other skill of your choosing at the same rating.
You take care of someone in a way that makes them obligated to help you out for a long time to come. Gain the Personal Connection trait
You learn the hard way that ignoring money management lessons was a bad idea. Lose 10,000 from your starting credit.
You take the fall for a crime you may or may not have been complicit in. Lose –10 c-rep but gain +1 Moxie.
An accident on a space elevator leaves you fearful of space. Gain the Phobia Disorder (Microgravity) trait
You start up an unusual hobby. Gain +20 to one Exotic Melee Weapon or Exotic Ranged Weapon skill.
You lose a bet and spend a month sleeved in a pod or uplift morph before it was cool. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table ignoring any result that is not an uplift or pod.
You make some life decisions that prove prescient after the Fall. Gain 20,000 credits.
You somehow stay safe and untouched by the chaos and horror. Gain +1 Moxie and roll on the Story Event table
You stay to the end, fighting a rear-guard action. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table  and gain +1 Moxie.
You are trapped on Earth when the homeworld is interdicted and quarantined. Take the Earth Survivor package  as your Faction package in Step 9.
You exemplify yourself in destroying TITAN machines. Take the Wrecker package  as your Focus package in Step 9.
Exposure to the Watts-MacLeod exsurgent virus opens your awareness to aspects of the world of which others are blind. Take the Savant Async package  as your Focus package in Step 9.
Infected with the Watts-MacLeod exsurgent virus, you learn to use your new powers forcefully. Take the Controller Async package  as your Focus package in Step 9.
After you are infected, you are trained to use your psi to kill. Take the Combat Async package  as your Focus package in Step 9.
Infection permanently changes your perceptions. Take the Scanner Async package  as your Focus package in Step 9.
You rack up a major debt to pay a bribe to get yourself off-world. Gain the Debt (Level 3) trait
You assume that you died on Earth, but you don’t know for sure. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table  and gain the Edited Memories trait
You know that the TITANs killed or uploaded you, according to reports. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You fall victim to the TITANs in Earth orbit, on Luna, or on Mars. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You are slain, not by the TITANs, but by hostile action from a rival government, faction, or hypercorp. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You hide your body away in cold storage on Earth before farcasting off to safety. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table

Your ego escapes the devastation of Earth, only to be locked away in cold storage for years. You are only recently resleeved. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table  and gain the Real World Naiveté trait
Your ego survives the Fall but is locked in simulspace for years before you are resleeved. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table  and gain +20 Interfacing skill.

After escaping the Fall, you are forced into indentured service before you are resleeved. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table  but ignore all non-synthmorph results. Gain +20 to one Technical skill.
You do what you can to help, but you still lose almost everyone in your life. Gain +1 Moxie.
You heroically sacrifice yourself so that others can escape. Gain +10 to one rep score and roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You risk your life in a desperate holding action. Gain the Brave trait
You are infected … but get better. Take the Async package  for 1 PP as your Focus package in Step 9.
You learn the hard way how susceptible you are to exsurgent influence. Gain the Psi Vulnerability trait
You encounter an exsurgent and are permanently changed by the experience. Take the Async Adept package  for 1 PP as your Focus package in Step 9.
The near extinction of your species hardens your resolve. Gain +5 WIL.
You hide and survive an encounter with exsurgents where others die. Gain the Psi Chameleon trait
You end up in possession of a rare Earth artifact worth 1d10 x 10,000 credits.
You make a bad call that gets people killed. Now you question your gut feelings. Lose –5 INT.
You were horrified at the idea of resleeving, but the alternative seemed worse—or so you thought. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table , and gain the Morphing Disorder (Level 3) trait
A nanoviral infection leaves you permanently damaged. Gain the Neural Damage trait
You have unfortunate memories of some … thing … eating your face off. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table , and gain the Timid trait
You witness unspeakable horrors during the Fall, standing idly by while others die. Gain the Combat Paralysis trait
Several near-death experiences hone your reflexes. Gain +5 REF.
Your relatives die, but you are left as the sole heir to the family’s modest wealth that made it off-world. Gain 25,000 credits.
You will never get the image of headhunter drones at work out of your mind. Gain the Mental Disorder (PTSD) trait.
You exhibit natural leadership in a time of crisis. Gain +10 to Persuasion or Intimidation.
The only way you can cope with the loss of your former life is through drugs. Gain the Drug Fiend trait
You cope with the horrors you experience in the midst of evacuation the only way you could—by postponing the trauma until you are safe. Gain the Trauma Tolerance (Level 1) trait
Your willingness to profit from others’ misery gains you respect in some circles. Lose 5 rep in one network of your choice, but gain 10 g-rep.
You experience things during the Fall that would leave others a shattered mess. Gain the Hardening trait
You lose everything—and nearly lose your mind as well. It will never recover its former strength. Gain the Frail Sanity trait
Not only do you die during the Fall, your backups are lost as well. You live on as a beta fork of your original self. Gain the Beta trait  and roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You lose a fortune during the Fall. Lose 10,000 credits from your starting credits.
You die during the Fall, but that doesn’t stop you from going to die again, and then again, and then again some more. Gain the Phoenix (Level 1) trait  and roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
After committing a crime, you are sentenced to indentured service, but the Fall lets you skip out. Gain the Deferred Indenture (Level 2) trait
You rack up an impressive kill score fighting TITAN machines. Gain the Tacnet Sniper trait
Your willingness to make lives a priority over material things earns you respect. Gain +10 @-rep.
You are hired by a wealthy private party for some exclusive exoplanet missions. Roll on the Gatecrashing Event table
You reinvent yourself. Gain +5 to one aptitude and –5 to another aptitude.
Your employer/collective sends you on a gatecrashing op. Roll on the Gatecrashing Event table
You score an achievement that leaves you indelibly marked in your faction’s consciousness. Gain the Untarnished Reputation trait
You create a major diplomatic incident. Gain the Black Mark (Level 3) trait
You fall victim to a terrorist attack or factional dispute. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
The merging of an overdue fork goes poorly, and coincidental inaccessible backups leave you permanently changed. Gain the Botched Merge trait
You are recruited to aid on a scientific mission. Roll on the Gatecrashing Event table
In order to keep up with the stress of your responsibilities, you fall into bad habits. Gain the Addiction (Moderate) trait
You do the right thing but piss off someone with power in the process. Gain 10 rep in a network of your choice, but also gain the Enemy trait
You use the post-Fall chaos to establish a new identity. Gain a Fake Ego ID for free.

After an unfortunate incident leads to lack (lost memories due to resleeving from an old backup), you decide security of mind is a worthy investment. Gain the Edited Memories trait and 1 year of backup insurance
After surviving the Fall and then only barely surviving a post-Fall clash, you decide that some self-defense training may be in order. Gain +20 to one Combat skill of your choice.
Through a strange set of circumstances, you end up with a rare Delphinium Six petal flower
You commit a crime, get caught, and suffer the punishment. Gain the Modified Behavior (Level 3) trait
You have died enough times that your mind really can’t take it any more. Gain the Phobia Disorder (Thanatophobia) trait
You save up and buy yourself a spot on a gatecrashing op. Roll on the Gatecrashing Event table
An ownerless bot begins following you and never leaves your side. Gain a servitor, saucer, or gnat bot for free.
An unknown party leaves you a portable QE comm unit with a high-capacity reservoir telling you only to expect a call in the future.
You travel extensively. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You’ve gotten really good at this resleeving thing. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table and gain the Adaptability (Level 1) trait
You narrowly avoid death in a disastrous accident. Gain the Danger Sense trait
You barely survive a murder attempt. Gain +5 INT.
A close-call with people out to get you puts you on the defensive. Gain the Informational Control trait
You’ve grown particular in your taste in morphs. Gain the Right At Home trait
You fall on hard times. Lose 10,000 credits from your starting credit.
You get caught in the cross-fire of a regional conflict. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
Your hectic lifestyle has increased your perceptive skills. Gain the Situational Awareness trait
A long string of personal failures has you questioning your own resolve. Lose –5 WIL.
No matter how often your friends warn you, you are promiscuous about your online data. Gain the Data Footprint trait
Nothing ever seems to go your way—your cursed luck is legendary. Gain the Bad Luck trait
You complete a major project of importance to your work/faction. Gain +10 to one rep score.
A project of importance to your work/faction fails under your direction. Lose –10 to one rep score.
You take up arms in a regional conflict. Gain +10 to one Combat skill.
Your work requires you to change your morph. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table but ignore results that don’t fit your most recent path.
You make an unpopular choice that burns many bridges. Gain the Blacklisted trait
A friend or relative opts for true death, but bequeaths you their estate. Gain 25,000 credits.
You are the unfortunate butt of a widespread online meme, but it works to your advantage. Gain the You’re That Guy! trait
You are the unfortunate butt of a widespread online meme, and it continues to haunt you. Gain the Wait, That Was You? trait
As transhumanity re-organizes, you find a role in influencing others. Gain +5 SAV.
You have difficulty coming to grips with regular resleeving. Gain the Identity Crisis trait
One of your resleeves goes particularly poorly, and now it haunts you. Gain the Morphing Disorder (Level 2) trait
You work hard to establish a solid network. +20 to one Networking skill.
You take up a sport. +10 to Climbing, Fray, Free Fall, Freerunning, or Swimming.
You decide to experiment. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
Practice makes perfect, and your hard work pays off. Increase one aptitude by +5.
You are the victim of an unfortunate crime. Lose 10,000 credits from your starting credits.
Someone steals your identity. Gain the Stolen Identity trait
You play a prominent role in mediating a factional conflict. Gain +20 Protocol.
You spend a significant portion of your life in one habitat. Gain the Home Turf trait
You take a bullet for someone you don’t even know. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table and gain +1 Moxie.
You piss off some powerful people and are made into an example. Gain the Black Mark (Level 1) trait
You make friends with a group of AGIs online. Gain the AGI Affinity trait
Due to a sudden financial crisis, you draw an emergency loan with unfavorable terms from an unforgiving loan shark. Gain the Debt (Level 1) trait
You commit a serious crime, but get away—for now. Gain the On the Run trait
You win the gatecrashing lottery and a free ticket to Pandora. Roll on the Gatecrashing Event table
You go into business. Gain the Entrepreneur (Level 1) trait
You become embroiled in a messy professional dispute. Lose –5 to one rep score.
You lose a contractual dispute in Extropian space. Gain the Deferred Indenture (Level 1) trait
You rack up some debts and are forced to downgrade your lifestyle. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table but re-roll any morph that is not at least 10 CP cheaper than your current morph.
You decide you need some help. Gain the Established Fork trait
You run afoul of a criminal cartel agent. You walk away unscathed, but the matter is far from resolved. Gain the Enemy trait
You get stuck with a boring, repetitive job, but at least you get really good at it. Gain one specialization for free.
Doing your part to aid transhumanity’s regrowth, you have a kid. Gain the Dependent trait
You have an unfortunately catastrophic sleeving accident, but the insurance paid well. Start play with 10 points of stress and a random derangement but you may choose your starting morph.
You achieve something that the members of your faction will never forget. Gain the Gold Star trait
You score an impressive win in a public competition. Gain +5 to one rep score.
You split off an alpha fork to handle an important situation, but it decides not to come back. Gain the Errant Fork trait
You take in an abandoned animal. Gain a smart dog, smart monkey, or smart rat for free.
You are the victim of a crime, but the perpetrator is caught. Now you hold their indenture contract. Gain the Indenture Holder trait
Everything is going great, but you still somehow manage to fuck up something major in your life. Gain +1 Moxie.
A severe personal failure inspires you to make some radical changes. Gain the Modified Behavior (Level 2) trait
You find your one true love. You don’t feel like your full self when you are away from them. Gain the Intense Relationship trait
You team up with a partner to get the job done. Gain the Minion/Partner trait
Someone you respect shows their true colors, and they aren’t pretty. Gain +1 Moxie.
Your exceptional nature is noticed. Gain the Patron trait
You get fired/kicked out. Lose 10,000 from your starting credit or –10 rep.
An established university offers you a steady position. Gain the Tenure trait
A fork goes missing. It could be nothing, but it was in possession of some compromising information about yourself. Gain the Lost Fork trait
You fall for the smooth lies of a convincing member of another faction. You realize your error only after the damage is done. Lose 10 rep from the rep network appropriate to your faction.
A trolling hacker ruins your life but leaves you with sporting goodbye offering. Lose 10 rep in one network of your choice, but gain a kaos AI for free.
You are forced to resleeve in less-than-favorable conditions and end up with a morph with issues. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table and gain the Aggressive GRM trait
You fall in with a new crowd—one that will have your back. Gain the Allies trait
You are part of a group that discovers a derelict ship and makes a great salvaging score. Gain 20,000 credits.
You join a cooperative project. Gain the Entrepreneur (Level 1) trait
You fight back against a perceived injustice, but are forced to flee the repercussions. Gain the On the Run trait
You drop everything to re-evaluate your priorities. Lose −30 to one skill, but gain 50 CP to spend on whatever you wish.
Unknown to you, someone takes an unfriendly interest in your affairs. Gain the Subverted Mind trait
You manage to get yourself killed three times in one week. At least you’re getting used to resleeving. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table and gain the Phoenix (Level 2) trait
Someone leaves you in charge of their spacecraft. Gain the Spacecraft trait
You are complicit in a faction suffering a major setback. Gain the Black Mark (Level 2) trait
You go on 1d10 gatecrashing missions, with no major consequences. You do see some cool things, though. Gain +1 Moxie.
You serve on 1d10 missions and pick up some new skills. Replace a 1 PP Focus, Faction, or Customization package you acquired in Step 10 with the Explorer package at 1 PP
You make a new home on Portal or some other exoplanet outpost.
You go through a gate but never come through on the other side. Start game with 10 points of stress and roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You receive some focused training in gate operations. Gain the Infosec (Gate Hacking) specialization
You acquire an alien pet. You’re not allowed to bring it back to the solar system, however. Work with the gamemaster to determine the creature’s characteristics.
You find an alien artifact, but they didn’t let you keep it. Gain 20,000 credits.
You discover a new xenocritter and its unique predatory capabilities. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
Your mission backers upgrade/downgrade your capabilities. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You participate in some eye-opening research. Gain +5 COG.
You discover left-behind TITAN machines. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You go on a mission and never return. Your sponsors refuse to talk about it. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
Your mission scores a major resource find. Gain 20,000 credits.
You receive some focused training in gate operations. Gain the Interfacing (Gate Operations) specialization
You join a semi-successful colonization effort for a year. Gain +20 to one Profession skill of your choice.
You uncover evidence of a previously unknown but long-dead alien race. Gain +10 to one rep score.
You put in several months of grueling work on a terraforming project. Gain +10 to one Academic, Profession, or Technical skill.
You severely botch a rescue operation. Lives are lost and stacks are not recovered. Lose 10 rep from the network of your choice.
You experience something while going through a gate that makes you never want to go through again. Gain the Phobia Disorder (Pandora Gates) trait
You participate in a dangerous rescue operation. Gain +10 rep in the network of your choice.
You receive some focused training in gate operations. Gain +20 Academics: Gate Operations
You come into possession of your very own blue box
You survive a lengthy gatehopping adventure. Gain +20 x-rep
Your mission is sabotaged by an unknown party. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You step through a gate and arrive somewhere other than you expected. Your jaunt is adventurous, but you make it back safe. Gain +10 Profession: Gatecrashing skill.
You receive some focused training in gate operations. Gain the Programming (Gate Interface) specialization
You end up in the middle of an exoplanet property-claim dispute. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You participate in a rescue op that cashes in on a sizable recovery bond. Gain 10,000 credits.
You are recruited by someone you know because of your skill sets. Gain +10 to one skill.
You accidentally stumble onto a Firewall op, and luckily for you they decide the best option is to recruit you. Gain +1 Moxie.
You work with/for someone who turns out to be an exhuman supporter. Once you get over the shock, Firewall recruits you. Gain +10 to Interest: Exhumans skill.
Firewall recruits you as an informant, to help keep tabs on someone or something they are worried about. Gain +10 Infosec skill.
Your ego was jailed/lost on Earth/forknapped/in cold storage, but Firewall broke you out in return for your aid. Gain +1 Moxie.
You spot someone acting suspiciously and report them. They turn out to be a Firewall async. You are repaid with recruitment and training. Gain the Async Familiarity trait

You are infected and secretly operate as a sleeper exsurgent for months or even years. Firewall restores you from an old backup. Gained the Edited Memories trait and roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You have an unexpected close encounter with the TQZ on Mars, the New Mumbai Containment Zone of Luna, or Iapetus. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
An exhuman raid leaves you and others dead; Firewall helps sort out the mess. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You are one of the few survivors of an exsurgent outbreak on your habitat. Gain the Psi Defense trait
You find a relic. Bad things happen. Firewall cleans up the mess. –10 to one rep score.
You were a member/supporter of one of the groups that evolved into Firewall from before the Fall. You took some time off, but now you’re back. Gain +10 i-rep.
You single-handedly foil an impending outbreak, but the local authorities blame you for the carnage. Firewall helps you escape. Gain the On the Run trait
A previously dormant TITAN nanoplague rampages through your habitat. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
Your ship stops to investigate/help a derelict ship and is never heard from again. Roll randomly on the Choosing a Morph table
You discover a lost cache on an isolated asteroid. Firewall actually lets you keep some of the find. Gain 1d10 x 5,000 credits.
You step into an unknown fray and are lucky enough to pick the right side. Gain +10 i-rep.
You uncover a conspiracy within your faction and Firewall steps in to help you deal with it. Gain +10 to one rep score.
You are recruited to help Firewall cover up a secret or outbreak. Lose –10 to one rep score but gain +10 i-rep.
You uncover a sleeper exsurgent cell the hard way. Gain the Phobia Disorder (Exsurgents) trait
You become aware of someone smuggling or dealing TITAN technology. Firewall steps in and deals with it, then recruits you. Lose 5 g-rep.
You were a member/supporter of one of the groups that evolved into Firewall from before the Fall. Gain +10 i-rep.
You are involved in a cover-up of a TITAN- or exsurgent-related secret during the Fall. Firewall finds you and brings you in to get the story. Gain +10 i-rep.
Someone you loved becomes infected. You keep it secret and protect them for a time, until everything goes bad. Firewall rescues you, then recruits you. Gain +10 Interest: Exsurgents.
You are a bit too good at ferreting out certain secrets online. Firewall brings you in to the fold to keep your mouth shut. Gain +10 Infosec skill.
Someone you are close to is a Firewall proxy; they brought you in to help them out. Gain +1 Moxie.

Thanks to a particular skill you have, Firewall has consulted with you for years without revealing themselves. They decide to fill you in on the full story. Gain or increase a Firewall-relevant Knowledge skill (such as Interest: Exsurgents or Academics: Nanotechnology) by +30.

A package you are hired to deliver turns out to be an alien artifact. When it causes problems, you go to a friend of a friend, who turns out to be a Firewall proxy. They solve the problem, but you fail to make the delivery. Gain the Enemy trait
After a long stretch of bad, you hit bottom. No way left to go but up.
You participate as a test subject in a research project. You suffer no ill effects … that you can tell.
A prominent journalist befriends you as a source and occasional confidante.
You hear from an unknown source that Oversight has taken an interest in your affairs.
You have an unfortunate run-in with Jovian Republic troops, but manage to extricate yourself.
After years, you finally get a chance to inflict revenge on someone. Do you take it or walk away?
You witness/survive a major disaster, such as a habitat failure, ship collision, terrorist attack, or a freak but deadly accident.
Circumstances force you to move from one end of the solar system to the other.
Your habitat goes through a regime change. Which side are you on?
You are falsely accused of a crime but then cleared.
You develop a long-term rival. The relationship is complex and non-dangerous, but it does occasionally interfere or consume your attention.
You develop a long-term life-partner relationship.
You suffer through the failure of a major long-term relationship.
You enter into a convenience-based contract-defined romantic relationship.
You develop an ongoing polyamorous relationship with a group of friends.
You are pursued by an irritating but (mostly) harmless suitor/ stalker.
You are recruited to secretly help some faction. Randomly determine that faction from the Factions table (p. 41).
You are re-united with a lover/relative/friend thought lost during the Fall.
Political upheaval in your local habitat/polity throws your life into turmoil.
You are the only survivor of a deadly accident on board a ship or small hab, which raises some suspicion …
Your life has been blissfully serene and untroubled. Your friends may secretly hate you.
You find out that one or both of your parents weren’t really your parents.
You pursue a period of self-isolation and introspection.
You catch an authority figure doing something illicit, but you don’t have the means to prove it.
You take a sabbatical with the Solarians, ringers, or other space-faring clade.
You have an affair.
You are privileged enough to meet a Factor.
You discover an unknown and intriguing or devastating secret about your family’s past.
An unfortunate accident leaves you stuck in a healing vat for a couple of weeks.
While traveling by spacecraft, a malfunction takes you months off course.
You use someone to get ahead.
Someone uses you to get ahead.
You unexpectedly make a close friend with someone from a rival or even hostile faction.
You have a falling out with a formerly close friend.
You are forced into a thankless position of heavy responsibility.
Facing unwanted responsibilities, you pack up and move on.
You are persecuted for your nature or beliefs.
You finalize a particularly good research paper, work of art, commercial enterprise, or similar achievement.
Someone close to you opts for a real, final death.
You discover a new subculture to embed yourself in.
You befriend a brinker with some interesting ideas and unbelievable stories. Well, almost unbelievable.
You find repeat evidence that someone has you under close surveillance—but why?
You are fairly certain that your new friend is secretly a singularity seeker.
You come across an interesting surveillance blind-spot in your local habitat.
A string of disappearances in your habitat has everyone on edge.
Someone you know has come across some disturbing information on a powerful entity, and they are considering blowing the whistle.
You don’t have what it takes, and your current job/prospect ends in a washout.
Your inquisitive nature leads you to discover a secret that could get you into trouble.
You receive a wake-up call that challenges your current priorities.
Your current job/pursuits take you somewhere dangerous,
